claims.claim: Blue is the standout color for 2024, replacing hot pink from 2023
claims.notes: Multiple sources confirm blue as dominant color, often paired with white for colorwork

claims.claim: Cardigans are the most popular garment type in 2024, especially longer lengths
claims.notes: From delicate lacy options to librarian style, cardigans dominate

claims.claim: Fair Isle colorwork continues strong trend from 2023 into 2024
claims.notes: Large colorwork designs especially popular for fall

claims.claim: European Shoulder Construction trending in modern Scandi designs
claims.notes: Shoulder seam shifted towards back, popular in Scandinavian patterns

claims.claim: Textured knitting (Aran, brioche) is a major 2024 trend
claims.notes: Thick raised patterns add depth and rich look

claims.claim: Fuzzy yarns with lace patterns creating halo effects are trending
claims.notes: Ethereal look when combined with openwork lace

claims.claim: Marling (pairing two contrasting colors for heathered look) is popular
claims.notes: Common with self-striping sock yarn and solids

claims.claim: Nautical/preppy style with chunky cables and bold stripes is trending
claims.notes: Influenced by Miu Miu fashion and sports-luxe aesthetic

claims.claim: 71-98% of knitters/yarn consumers are female
claims.notes: Different surveys show range from 71% to 98% female

claims.claim: Average age of yarn consumers is 58 years old (2024 survey)
claims.notes: Based on 7,000+ respondent survey in 2024

claims.claim: Age distribution is fairly even: 34% aged 18-34, 36% aged 35-54, 30% aged 55+
claims.notes: Shows broad appeal across age groups

claims.claim: Global knitting yarn market valued at $4.7 billion in 2024, projected to reach $7.11 billion by 2033
claims.notes: CAGR of 4.5% projected

claims.claim: Knitting and crochet market to grow by $10.69 billion from 2024-2028
claims.notes: CAGR of 6.4% from Technavio report

claims.claim: COVID-19 pandemic caused 646% sales surge at some retailers (Swiss Galaxus)
claims.notes: Lion Brand reported 80% increase, We Are Knitters 75%

claims.claim: Long-term interest has declined from 2015 peak, with pandemic providing temporary spike
claims.notes: Google search trends show 15-year decline overall

claims.claim: 56% of yarn consumers buy more online now than last year
claims.notes: Pandemic shopping changes still present

claims.claim: 74% of knitters use Ravelry platform
claims.notes: Ravelry remains dominant community platform

claims.claim: 23 million+ Instagram posts with #knitting hashtag
claims.notes: Shows strong social media presence

claims.claim: Knitting identified as Spring 2024 TikTok trend alongside coquette bows
claims.notes: Part of broader hands-on crafting revival on social media

claims.claim: DIY and sustainable materials drive 58% of demand, especially among ages 18-34
claims.notes: Younger consumers prioritize eco-friendly options

claims.claim: Recycled yarn options growing: Knitting for Olive No Waste Wool, Rowan Cotton Revive
claims.notes: 50% recycled wool blends, regenerated cotton fibers

claims.claim: Indie dyers make approximately $2 profit per skein
claims.notes: Profitability challenges in indie dyer market

claims.claim: Cotton prices increased from 47.55 cents/lb (2020) to 117.87 cents/lb (2024)
claims.notes: Raw material cost increases driving yarn prices

claims.claim: Australian merino wool prices up 56% since 2016, reaching ~$14/kg
claims.notes: Australia produces most merino wool globally

claims.claim: Size-inclusive patterns now expected to go to at least 5X or 60" bust
claims.notes: Industry standard has evolved, some go to 70"

claims.claim: KnitCompanion app rated 4.7/5 with subscription at $9.99/year
claims.notes: Updated September 2024, popular pattern tracking app

claims.claim: Over 60% of hobbyists rely on online tutorials, mobile apps, and e-learning
claims.notes: Digital learning transformed knitting education

claims.claim: Local Yarn Store Day 2024 held April 27th
claims.notes: Annual celebration supporting brick-and-mortar yarn shops

claims.claim: Craftivism continues as political expression through knitting
claims.notes: Examples: Social Justice Sewing Academy, Knitting Nannas Against Gas

claims.claim: Patchwork-inspired knitting making comeback, influenced by upcycled fashion
claims.notes: Eco-friendly, budget-conscious using leftover yarn
